item.title: 聚焦：自由港提高铜产量，竞争对手寻求交易以实现增长
item.description: 自由港麦克莫兰公司（Freeport-McMoRan）正在三大洲加大铜产量，但并不打算加入席卷采矿业的收购狂潮，分析师认为，该公司的这一战略很好地利用了清洁能源转型对红色金属日益增长的需求。【原文：Freeport-McMoRan is turbo-charging its copper output across three continents with no plans to join a buyout frenzy sweeping the mining industry, a strategy that analysts say positions the company well to capitalize on the clean energy transition's rising demand for the red metal.】

item.title: 中国表示将着力解决突出的经济问题
item.description: 周日，中国国家媒体援引中国内阁会议的消息报道称，中国将着力解决突出经济问题，努力完成年度经济社会发展目标。【原文：China said it will focus on solving outstanding economic problems and strive to complete annual economic and social development goals, state media reported on Sunday, citing a meeting of China's cabinet, or government.】

item.title: 电池金属交易势头强劲，LME落后于竞争对手的交易所
item.description: 在主导锂和钴等电动汽车电池用金属贸易的竞争中，伦敦金属交易所被甩在了后面，因为其他交易所利用从年度固定价格合同向期货套期保值的转变，势头正劲。【原文：The London Metal Exchange is being left behind in the race to dominate trade in metals used for EV batteries such as lithium and cobalt as other exchanges gain momentum, capitalising on a shift from annual fixed-price contracts to hedging with futures.】

item.title: 当一元店倒闭时，领取食品补助的美国家庭就失去了一条生命线
item.description: 纳什维尔 37 岁的拉翠娜-贝格利（Latrina Begley）或她六个孩子中的一个，几乎每天都会到家山下的家庭美元（Family Dollar）购物，用联邦食品补贴购买热狗、冷冻披萨和牛奶等主食。【原文：Nearly every day, Latrina Begley, 37, of Nashville, or one of her six children, shopped at the Family Dollar down the hill from their home, using federal food benefits to buy Hot Pockets or frozen pizza, and staples like milk.】

item.title: 1-8月中国国有企业利润同比下降2.1
item.description: 中国财政部周日在其网站上发表声明称，1-8月，中国国有企业利润同比下降2.1%。【原文：China's state-owned firms' profits were down 2.1% year for January to August from the same period last year, the Ministry of Finance said in a statement on its website on Sunday.】

item.title: 印度将调查塔塔为苹果公司生产 iPhone 组件的工厂起火事件
item.description: 泰米尔纳德邦一名官员周日表示，印度当局将开始对一家为苹果 iPhone 生产零部件的塔塔电子工厂周六发生火灾的原因进行法证调查。【原文：Indian authorities are set to begin a forensic investigation into the cause of a fire that broke out on Saturday at a Tata Electronics factory that makes components for Apple iPhones, a Tamil Nadu state official said on Sunday.】

item.title: 报纸报道：瑞银集团主席警告不要大幅提高资本要求
item.description: 瑞银集团主席科尔姆-凯莱赫（Colm Kelleher）周日警告说，瑞士政府加强对大银行资本要求的计划可能会损害该国作为金融中心的地位。【原文：UBS Chair Colm Kelleher warned on Sunday that the Swiss government's plans to strengthen capital requirements for big banks could damage the country's position as a financial centre.】

item.title: 拒绝向美国参议院作证的 Steward Health 首席执行官将下台
item.description: 拉尔夫-德拉托雷（Ralph de la Torre）将于下周辞去陷入困境的 Steward Health Care 公司首席执行官一职，该公司周六表示，拉尔夫-德拉托雷因拒绝就该集团旗下 31 家医院在申请破产前削减成本的决定作证而被美国参议院以刑事藐视法庭罪起诉。【原文：Ralph de la Torre will step down as CEO of troubled Steward Health Care next week, the company said on Saturday, after he was held in criminal contempt by the U.S. Senate for refusing to testify about cost-cutting decisions at the group's 31 hospitals before it filed for bankruptcy.】

item.title: 埃克森董事加入埃利奥特集团，寻求收购 Citgo 石油公司
item.description: 埃克森美孚董事会董事格雷戈里-戈夫（Gregory Goff）最近加入了埃利奥特投资管理公司（Elliott Investment Management）支持的一家新成立的公司，该公司寻求收购委内瑞拉炼油商 Citgo Petroleum 的控制权。【原文：Exxon Mobil board director Gregory Goff recently joined a newly formed Elliott Investment Management-backed company seeking to acquire control of Venezuela-owned oil refiner Citgo Petroleum.】

item.title: 独家消息：消息人士称，TPG 将以 150 亿美元的估值收购 Creative Planning 的股份
item.description: 熟悉内情的人士周六表示，收购公司 TPG 已成为收购 Creative Planning 价值 20 亿美元少数股权的领跑者，这笔交易可能使这家财富管理公司的估值超过 150 亿美元。【原文：Buyout firm TPG has emerged as the frontrunner to pick up a minority stake worth $2 billion in Creative Planning, in a deal that could value the wealth management firm at more than $15 billion, people familiar with the matter said on Saturday.】

item.title: 消息人士称，意大利联合信贷银行首席执行官 Orcel 出席了与德国商业银行的虚拟会议
item.description: 一位知情人士告诉路透社，意大利联合信贷银行（UniCredit）首席执行官 Andrea Orcel 在成为德国商业银行最大的私人投资者后，出席了该行周五与德国商业银行举行的虚拟会议。【原文：UniCredit chief Andrea Orcel attended a virtual meeting the Italian bank held on Friday with Commerzbank after becoming the German lender's biggest private investor, a source with knowledge of the matter told Reuters.】

item.title: 沃尔玛旗下 Flipkart 的在线卖家就反垄断调查起诉印度监察机构
item.description: 根据路透社看到的法庭文件，在沃尔玛旗下的 Flipkart 上运营的三家在线卖家起诉了印度反垄断监督机构，因为该机构在调查中发现他们、Flipkart 和竞争对手亚马逊违反了竞争法。【原文：Three online sellers operating on Walmart -owned Flipkart have sued the Indian antitrust watchdog over an investigation which found they, Flipkart and rival Amazon breached competition laws, according to court filings seen by Reuters.】

item.title: 蒂森克虏伯钢铁部门主管为 "艰难 "裁员做好准备
item.description: 蒂森克虏伯集团钢铁部门的新任负责人告诉德国一家报纸，该集团的 27,000 名钢铁工人必须为大幅裁员做好准备。【原文：Thyssenkrupp's 27,000 steel workers must brace for deep cuts, the new head of the conglomerate's steel division told a German newspaper, setting the stage for significant layoffs.】

item.title: 关注：如果您的人工智能看起来更聪明，那要归功于更聪明的人类培训师
item.description: 早年，要让 ChatGPT 或其竞争对手 Cohere 等人工智能模型做出类似人类的反应，需要大量低成本员工帮助模型分辨基本事实，比如一张图片是汽车还是胡萝卜。【原文：In the early years, getting AI models like ChatGPT or its rival Cohere to spit out human-like responses required vast teams of low-cost workers helping models distinguish basic facts such as if an image was of a car or a carrot.】

item.title: 塔塔 iPhone 零部件工厂因火灾中断，10 人接受医疗救助
item.description: 目前尚未决定何时可以重新开始生产。【原文：No decision has been made on when manufacturing can restart.】

item.title: 工会称波音工资谈判破裂，结束罢工毫无进展
item.description: 国际机械师和航空航天工人协会（IAM）周五晚些时候表示，其与波音公司的薪资协议谈判已经破裂，目前没有安排进一步的谈判日期。【原文：The International Association of Machinists and Aerospace Workers (IAM) said late on Friday that its pay deal talks with Boeing had broken off and that there were no further dates scheduled for negotiations at this time.】

item.title: 华尔街日报》报道：道明银行可能在洗钱调查中认罪
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》周五报道，道明银行（TD Bank）即将可能承认一项刑事指控，即其美国零售银行未能遏制与中国犯罪集团和非法芬太尼销售有关的洗钱活动。【原文：TD Bank is close to a possible guilty plea to criminal charges that its U.S. retail bank failed to curb money laundering tied to Chinese crime groups and illicit fentanyl sales, the Wall Street Journal reported on Friday.】

item.title: 华尔街日报》称苹果退出加入 OpenAI 投资回合谈判
item.description: 华尔街日报》周五称，苹果公司已退出参与 OpenAI 一轮融资的谈判，预计该轮融资将筹集约 65 亿美元。【原文：Apple has left negotiations to participate in an OpenAI funding round expected to raise about $6.5 billion, the Wall Street Journal said on Friday.】

item.title: UAW 敦促斯泰兰特工人批准罢工，指责汽车制造商违反合同
item.description: 美国汽车工人联合会（UAW）主席肖恩-费恩（Shawn Fain）周五在致该联合会美国分会的一封信中说，美国汽车工人联合会要求斯泰兰特公司的工人授权举行罢工，指责这家法国意大利汽车制造商违背了合同承诺。【原文：The United Auto Workers union asked the workers at Stellantis to authorize a strike, accusing the French-Italian car maker of breaking its contract promises, UAW President Shawn Fain said in a letter to the union's U.S. chapters on Friday.】

item.title: OpenAI 明年营收将达 116 亿美元，为 Thrive 提供了在 2025 年再次投资的机会
item.description: 熟悉内情的人士周五表示，Thrive Capital 在 OpenAI 目前的 65 亿美元募资轮中投资了超过 10 亿美元，而且还得到了其他投资者没有得到的甜头：如果这家人工智能公司达到营收目标，Thrive Capital 有可能在明年以同样的估值再投资 10 亿美元。【原文：Thrive Capital is investing more than $1 billion of OpenAI's current $6.5 billion fundraising round, and it has a sweetener no other investors are getting: the potential to invest another $1 billion next year at the same valuation if the AI firm hits a revenue goal, people familiar with the matter said on Friday.】

item.title: 全球主动管理型 ETF 资产规模突破 1 万亿美元
item.description: 数据提供商 ETFGI 的数据显示，在更宽松的监管和产品创新浪潮的推动下，全球主动管理交易所交易基金（ETF）的资产在 8 月底达到了创纪录的 1 万亿美元。【原文：Assets in actively managed exchange-traded funds (ETFs) worldwide hit a record $1 trillion at the end of August, according to data provider ETFGI, boosted by easier regulations and a wave of product innovation.】

item.title: 巴西最高法院裁定 X 必须支付未付罚款才能恢复服务
item.description: 巴西最高法院周五表示，根据一份法庭文件，社交平台 X 需要支付略高于 500 万美元的罚款，才能恢复其在巴西的服务。【原文：Brazilian Supreme Court said on Friday that social platform X needs to pay just over $5 million in pending fines in order to resume its service in the country, according to a court document.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，Binance 创始人赵明从美国拘留所获释
item.description: 据彭博新闻社援引监狱管理局发言人的话报道，Binance 创始人赵长鹏周五从加利福尼亚州的一家惩教机构获释。【原文：Binance founder Changpeng Zhao was released from a correctional facility in California on Friday, Bloomberg News reported, citing a spokesperson for the Bureau of Prisons.】

item.title: 美国法官就家属反对波音认罪协议举行听证会
item.description: 美国联邦地区法官里德-奥康纳（Reed O'Connor）周五表示，他将于 10 月 11 日举行听证会，审议两起波音 737 MAX 飞机坠毁事故中遇难者亲属对该飞机制造商承认共谋欺诈犯罪协议的反对意见。【原文：U.S. District Judge Reed O'Connor said Friday he will hold a hearing on Oct. 11 to consider objections from relatives of those killed in two Boeing 737 MAX crashes to the planemaker's agreement to plead guilty to criminal fraud conspiracy.】

item.title: 美国医疗保险计划称 2025 年 D 部分和优势部分保费将下降
item.description: 美国医疗保险与医疗补助服务中心（Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services）周五表示，预计2025年医疗保险处方药计划和私人医疗保险计划的平均保费和福利将保持稳定，保费略有下降。【原文：Average premiums and benefits for Medicare's prescription drug program and private Medicare plans are projected to remain stable in 2025 with premiums slightly declining, the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services said on Friday.】

item.title: 华尔街一周前瞻 就业数据考验美国股市软着陆希望
item.description: 投资者对美国经济软着陆的希望将在下周经受考验，因为在一系列令人失望的就业报告发布后，政府将公布备受关注的劳动力市场数据。【原文：Investor hopes for a soft landing for the U.S. economy will be put to the test next week, as the government releases closely watched labor market data following a series of disappointing jobs reports.】

item.title: 研究显示，2030 年巴西混合动力和电动汽车销量将超过其他市场
item.description: 巴西汽车制造商协会 Anfavea 周五发布的一份研究报告显示，预计到 2030 年，巴西新型全电动或混合动力汽车的销量将超过内燃机汽车。【原文：The sales of new fully electric or hybrid cars in Brazil are expected to surpass sales of vehicles run on combustion engines in 2030, a study released on Friday by automakers association Anfavea showed.】

item.title: 拜登称未改变对新日铁交易的看法
item.description: 美国总统乔-拜登（Joe Biden）周五表示，尽管新日本制铁公司（Nippon Steel）以 149 亿美元的价格竞购美国钢铁公司（U.S. Steel）的计划已被延长国家安全审查，但他并没有改变主意。【原文：U.S. President Joe Biden on Friday said he had not changed his mind about Nippon Steel's $14.9 billion bid for U.S. Steel despite the extension of a national security review of the proposed tie-up.】

item.title: 在港口可能发生罢工之前，美墨铁路延误打击了农业部门
item.description: 农业团体周五表示，铁路积压正在干扰美国和墨西哥之间的出口贸易，并在秋收之际阻断了农产品供应链。【原文：Rail backlogs are disrupting export trade between the United States and Mexico and snarling agricultural supply chains as the fall harvest is under way, agriculture groups said on Friday.】

item.title: 穆萨莱姆称美联储应 "逐步 "降息
item.description: 圣路易斯联邦储备银行行长阿尔贝托-穆萨莱姆周五表示，美国央行应该 "循序渐进 "地降低利率，在此之前，他将上周降息半个百分点称为 "强烈而明确的信息"，他表示支持降息。【原文：St. Louis Federal Reserve Bank President Alberto Musalem on Friday said the U.S. central bank should cut interest rates "gradually" after what he called the "strong and clear message" of a half-point interest-rate cut last week, which he said he supported.】
